subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=僊,仚,屳}}
A relatively late word, perhaps {{der|zh|sit}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). Compare {{cog|bo|གཤེན||shaman}}, as in {{cog|bo|གཤེན་རབ||Shenrab}}, the founder of the Tibetan religion {{w|Bon}}, although this might be a loan from Chinese ([[ibid]].). {{zh-ref|Starostin}} sets up {{inh|zh|sit-pro||*s[ă]n|a kind of demon}}, comparing it to {{cog|bo|བསེན་མོ||female devil}} and {{cog|kac|sawn||malignant female [[nat]]}}.
